title: Formal Ontology-Based Instructional Design Theory for Micro-Learning in [Large-Scale] Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy and secondary education experience
context.additional_context: Learners must acquire practical skills in designing efficient mobile learning activities based on foundational understanding of social issues. Applies instructional design methodologies through limited use of OWL/SWRL-based ontology tools.

learning_goals: Learners can represent learning activity sequences according to IMS LD standards using ontology tools in at least three ways
Learners can implement at least two instructional design constraints using SWRL rules
Learners can design 5-minute microlearning modules optimized for mobile environments
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
